name: Catholic Charities of Dallas
description: CCD helps over 275,000 individuals achieve stability and self-sufficiency through financial literacy, employment services, education, food programs, immigration legal services, refugee resettlement, disaster services, and permanent supportive housing.

name: Light of Hope Immigration Law Center
description: We also provide pro bono support to the community. Our free citizenship classes this spring provided 85 hours of instruction to 21 students, 4 of whom became naturalized citizens.

name: Human Rights Initiative of North Texas
description: Free legal services to Asylum seekers fleeing persecution based on religion, race, ethnicity, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group,Immigrants abused by a U.S. Citizen or Lawful Permanent Resident (Green Card holder) spouse, Immigrant children who are victims of violent crimes, neglect, abuse, or abandonment.

name: International Rescue Committee
description: We help to restore health, safety, education, economic wellbeing and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster.

name: RAICES
description: Refugee and Immigration Center for Education and Legal Services
address:
4230 Lyndon B Johnson Fwy, Suite 225
Dallas, TX 75244
notes: Will take cases from all Detention and Enforcement Centers

name: University of Texas School of Law Immigration Clinic
description: Students in the Immigration Clinic represent vulnerable low-income immigrants from all over the world before the immigration and federal courts and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS).
address:
727 East Dean Keeton Street
Austin, TX 78705-3299

name: South Texas Immigration Council, Inc
description: The South Texas Immigration Council, Inc. (Harlingen Office) offers a wide range of legal immigration services to the immigrant population of Rio Grande Valley and the surrounding areas.

name: ProBAR - South Texas Pro Bono Asylum Representation Project
description: The South Texas Pro Bono Asylum Representation Project (ProBAR) empowers immigrants through high-quality legal education, representation, and connections to services

name: Texas RioGrande Legal Aid
description: TRLA serves the people of Texas to ensure that a fair chance at justice is never out of reach for those who need it most.

name: American Gateways
description: To champion the dignity and human rights of immigrants, refugees and survivors of persecution, torture, conflict and human trafficking through exceptional immigration legal services at no or low cost, education and advocacy.
address:
314 E. Highland Mall Blvd., Suite 501
Austin, TX 78752

name: Kids in Need of Defense (KIND)
description: Advancing laws, policies, and practices that ensure children’s protection and uphold their right to due process and fundamental fairness and promoting in countries of origin, transit, and destination durable solutions to child migration that are grounded in the best interests of the child and ensure that no child is forced to involuntarily migrate.
address:
1303 San Jacinto Street, 9th Floor
Houston, TX 77002

name: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Galveston-Houston
description: Guided by God’s love, Catholic Charities helps people in southeast Texas by providing caring, compassionate services and advocating for social justice in collaboration with parishes and communities.

name: Diocesan Migrant and Refugee Services
description: A ministry of the Catholic Diocese of El Paso, Diocesan Migrant and Refugee Services, Inc. (DMRS) is the only full-service immigration legal aid clinic serving low-income immigrants and refugees residing in the southwestern United States.
address:
2400 E. Yandell, Ste. A
El Paso, TX 79903-3617

name: Las Americas Immigrant Advocacy Center
description: Las Americas is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in El Paso, Texas providing free and low-cost legal services to immigrants and refugees in West Texas and New Mexico. We have served over 40,000 people from over 77 countries since 1987.
address:
1500 E Yandell Drive
El Paso, TX 79902

name: Dallas Bar Association
description: The DBA's purpose is to serve and support the legal profession in Dallas and to promote good relations among lawyers, judges, and the community.
